div.div: "Every Child, Every Day, Whatever it Takes!"

div.div: April is National Child Abuse Awareness Month. If you are concerned for a child's safety, call the Missouri Child Abuse and Neglect hotline at 1-800-392-3738. This is a toll free line that is answered 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. If a child is in immediate danger, please call 911.
VIEW MORE About Child Abuse Awareness Month

In response to the quarantine, several broadband providers are temporarily offering free internet service, waiving disconnect and late fees, providing access to wi-fi hot spots and other measures to help people at home access the services they need. Click here to find out more.
VIEW MORE About Internet and Wifi Offerings

As you may already know school closure will be extended for the remainder of the academic year (May 15th). We are all saddened by this but I want to assure you your child will be alright. It is hard to put it in perspective but I want to remind you that this is a small time in comparison to the 13 years your child has been or will be in school.
VIEW MORE About Seneca R-7 Health Update- April 10

Do you know a child who will be five years old on or before July 31? Maybe it's your neighbor, family friend or even your own child. Spread the word...now is the time to let us know! Fill out the form below so we can keep you up to date on upcoming events such as kindergarten screening and enrollment. If you have any questions please call the elementary office at 417-776-2785 Mondays or Thursdays between 8 and noon.
VIEW MORE About Turning 5 Before July 31?

Beginning Monday, March 23, meals can be picked up or delivered on Mondays and Thursdays. On those days, several days worth of food will be given out. To see the list of delivery stops or to sign up for meals/delivery, please click "Read More."
VIEW MORE About Meal Assistance and Delivery

Seneca R-7 is experiencing a driver shortage and is looking for individuals to fill open routes. You do not need to have your CDL to apply. We offer paid training and will help you obtain your class B CDL. You must be 21 to apply. Employees will be on the same schedule as their children and able to drive their field trips. You may apply on the district website under Substitute Bus Driver, or call us at 776-5577 with any questions you may have.
VIEW MORE About Bus Drivers Needed!

Seneca R-7 Schools is seeking qualified candidates for several teaching and coaching positions. Our district prides itself in it's culture of learning and growth both for students and staff. If you are interested in joining our family, click here to apply!

Seneca Elementary has kicked off their annual SES Reads program. This year, students will be reading "The Chocolate Touch" by Patrick Skene Catling. Each student in the elementary received a book and will be reading it together each night. At the end of February, the school will celebrate the book during a "Sweet Celebration". Click here to find out more!
VIEW MORE About SES Reads 2020 Kickoff!

We’re in the process of putting together a 3 to 5-year Technology Plan for the school district. We’d like to invite you to participate in this process by giving us your feedback on the survey linked below. We’ll use the compiled information from all of our Seneca families to help us build a Technology Plan that makes sense for our district. Your student(s) will also be bringing the paper version of this survey home soon. Please help us by filling out either the paper version or the online version by following the link below. Thank you!
VIEW MORE About Technology Needs Assessment

div.p: Seneca R-7 Schools wants to welcome you to a new school year and a brand new web space for the Seneca community. Seneca R-7 has a wide reputation for academic and athletic excellence. Progressive teaching methods, technology integration, and dedicated staff help prepare students K-12 for success in the future. The district is deeply rooted in Tradition, Pride, and Class, which makes the district a very special place.

p.strong: Seneca R-7 Schools, where “Every Child, Every Day, Whatever it Takes!” is the backbone of our learning approach.
